homes_hear_details: Massachusetts has launched both HOMES and HEAR programs, administered through the Mass Save program and the Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources. The state received approximately $114 million in IRA funding, supplementing the already robust Mass Save energy efficiency programs.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in Boston, 80% AMI is approximately $90,650. Low-income households qualify for up to 100% of project costs under HOMES and receive no-cost services through Mass Save income-eligible programs.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in Boston, 150% AMI is approximately $169,950. Moderate-income households qualify for rebates covering up to 50% of project costs under HOMES, with enhanced Mass Save incentives.

net_metering: Massachusetts offers net metering with tiered capacity classes. Residential systems under 10 kW receive full retail-rate net metering credits. Larger systems receive credits that may exclude certain charges. The SMART program (Solar Massachusetts Renewable Target) provides additional incentive payments. Virtual net metering and community shared solar are permitted.

state_tax_credits.name: Massachusetts Residential Renewable Energy Income Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 15% of the net expenditure on a qualifying renewable energy system, up to $1,000 maximum credit
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV, solar thermal, wind energy systems installed on the taxpayer's primary residence in Massachusetts
state_tax_credits.details: Non-refundable tax credit that can be carried forward for up to 3 years. Must be the taxpayer's primary residence. The net cost is calculated after subtracting any grants, rebates, or other incentives received.

state_tax_credits.name: Massachusetts Solar Renewable Energy Certificates (SRECs) via SMART Program
state_tax_credits.amount: Incentive rates vary by capacity block, utility territory, and adders (approximately $0.03-$0.12/kWh for 10-20 year terms)
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV systems installed in Massachusetts utility territories (Eversource, National Grid, Unitil)
state_tax_credits.details: The SMART program replaced the SREC II program and provides fixed, declining incentive payments for solar generation over 10-20 year terms. Low-income and community shared solar projects receive additional adders.

state_rebate_programs.name: Mass Save Residential Rebates and Incentives
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Mass Save (joint program of MA gas and electric utilities and energy efficiency service providers)
state_rebate_programs.amount: $50-$16,000+ depending on measure; up to 100% coverage for income-eligible
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps (air source and ground source), insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, windows, doors, heat pump water heaters, weatherization
state_rebate_programs.details: Mass Save is one of the most comprehensive energy efficiency programs in the nation. Includes free home energy assessments, 0% interest HEAT loans up to $50,000, and generous rebates. Income-eligible households receive no-cost insulation and HVAC upgrades. Enhanced heat pump rebates of up to $16,000 for whole-home heat pump conversions.

state_rebate_programs.name: Mass Save HEAT Loan Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Mass Save partner utilities and participating lenders
state_rebate_programs.amount: 0% interest loans up to $50,000 with terms up to 7 years
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, HVAC systems, heat pumps, windows, water heaters, solar thermal, and other qualifying energy improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: One of the most generous energy efficiency financing programs in the country. No income restrictions. Must have a Mass Save home energy assessment before applying.

state_rebate_programs.name: Massachusetts Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair/replacement, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies.

programs.name: Mass Save Residential Rebates (Eversource)
programs.amount: $50-$10,000+ depending on measure and income eligibility
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: Mass Save Home Energy Assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy assessment including blower door testing and thermal imaging

programs.name: ConnectedSolutions Demand Response
programs.amount: Up to $1,500/year for battery storage participation; thermostat and EV programs also available
programs.eligible_items: Battery storage systems, smart thermostats, EV chargers enrolled in demand response

programs.name: Mass Save Residential Rebates (National Grid)
programs.amount: $50-$10,000+ depending on measure and income eligibility
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: National Grid ConnectedSolutions
programs.amount: Up to $1,500/year for battery storage; seasonal incentives for thermostat and EV programs
programs.eligible_items: Battery storage, smart thermostats, EV chargers for demand response

programs.name: Mass Save Residential Rebates (Unitil)
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, appliances, weatherization
